cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SSW of Great Exuma Island and 370 mi ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across eastern-central Cuba today, forecast to turn northwest near the Florida Keys Saturday, then track northward just offshore the west coast of Florida toward a Florida Big Bend / eastern Panhandle landfall late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend or eastern Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest coast of Florida from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef; several provinces of central Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern and central Cuba, the Bahamas, Florida Keys, entire west coast of Florida, Florida Big Bend and eastern Panhandle, then inland portions of GA/AL/TN
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30-40 mph) possible late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal rise (<3 ft) possible at high tide along the St. Johns River mouth and adjacent beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 3â€“6 inches with localized higher totals, creating urban and small-stream flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; hazardous seas for port approaches
